intro: Scabiosa monspeliensis, commonly known as the rock scabious, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing form and its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often gray-green in color, adapted to thrive in rocky or dry soils. It is part of the Caprifoliaceae family and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Scabiosa monspeliensis is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
